title: What is the best electric drum set to buy that is under $500? - Quora

response.answer_text: You would get either get a fairly new entry level one or get a second-hand mid-level one at that price range. Some really cheap entry level kits are terrible, but some cheaper Roland/Yamaha and even Alesis kits that I’ve tried have been pretty good for the price range. Alesis Nitro Kit and Roland TD-1K should both be under $500 - check out the guide on this: Electronic Drum Set Reviews and Buyer’s Guide 2017 - Electronic Drum Advisor Otherwise, either check out local listings or sites for second hand options! If doing that then try to get one with a Roland Mesh snare pad or some Yamaha Silicone pads, I think that’s the best benefit of the higher level of electronic drum sets. Martin

There are several drum sets available on different sites of Internet which are affordable and can also fall under $500. But before buying it from any sites you must undergo through their latest reviews mentioned on the sites. According to me, I think that alesis nitro review is the best. This drum module all feel stunningly realistic for imitations, and it packs a punch in terms of the wide number of built-in sounds and sound sets available to the user. This drum had 108 sounds, and offers 15 programmable drum sets which have the ability to express multiple sounds through a single pad.
